Row.Text: A City-State inspired by the Hyperdimension Neptunia series. This nation never appears in the games themselves, but could feasibly appear in the setting at some point.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This City-State references the 3DO.

+0.4% [ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares per turn for Civilizations which can earn Shares; +0.2% Shares per turn returned to Others for Civilizations which cannot.

Basilicoms are highly modernized places of worship dedicated to the praising of CPUs and the teaching of their moral codes. In many dimensions, nations have a single, gigantic Basilicom which serves several functions at once: a massive place for congregations to meet, the central administrative building of the national government, and the personal home of the CPU herself. In this dimension, however, these roles are separated, and Basilicoms are now purely religious in nature.
Can only be built in cities following a religion with the Basilicoms belief. Construct this building by purchasing it with [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
Use [ICON_PEACE] Faith to purchase Basilicoms (+2 [ICON_PEACE] Faith, +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, +0.04% [ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares (+0.02% to the Others pool for non-Share Civilizations))

[ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares are a special Yield which may only be accrued by Vicevirtuoso's Hyperdimension Neptunia Civilizations. They are used to enable their leaders to "Go HDD," or transform into a new leader with a powerful Trait which typically scales in effectiveness with the number of Shares owned. When in HDD form, you will lose {1_Num} Shares per turn. Obtaining Shares is critical to success as one of these Civilizations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Shares are unique among Yields in that there is a finite amount of them shared amongst all of the world's Civilizations. Even Civilizations which cannot obtain Shares can still influence the amount of shares in the "Others" pool, which cannot directly be used by anyone. In other words, the accruement of Shares is a zero-sum game, and other Civilizations acquiring them may very well be stealing them from you![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There are many ways to obtain Shares, all of which are listed below.

The number of followers of the [ICON_RELIGION] Religion you have founded will grant [ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares. You will receive {1_Num} Shares per follower (rounds down to the hundredths of a percent). However, every other Religion in the world will receive the same, including those which are not Neptunia Civilizations! It is imperative to spread your Religion and eliminate others' Religions if you want to keep your Shares high.

The following Buildings grant [ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares. The first number represents what a Neptunia Civilization earns, the second number represents what other Civilizations return to the Others pool:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]
The following Improvements grant [ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares when worked:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]

Upon discovering {1_Tech}, Neptunia Civilizations can produce Shares in their Cities. Unlike in previous versions of this mod, this does not cost [ICON_PEACE] Faith. You will receive Shares per turn equal to your [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production multiplied by {2_Multiplier}. This Multiplier is increased if you were beaten to founding a Religion and all of the available Religions in the world have been founded. Additionally, some Traits can increase how many Shares you receive from this process.

You will receive {1_Num} Shares per 1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness (rounds down to the hundredth). Be careful, though: if your empire is Unhappy, you will instead lose {2_Num} Shares per [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness!

Every level of Cultural Influence you have reached over every other Civilization in the world will grant you {1_Num} Shares. For example, if you reach Popular Influence over a Civilization, you would receive Shares equal to the previous number multiplied by 3. This would then be repeated for every other Civilization in the world.

Conquest is one of the quickest paths to earning Shares. The following actions affect your Shares, but be wary that some of them will cause you to lose Shares![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Killing a Barbarian: {1_Num}[NEWLINE]Killing a non-Barbarian Unit: {2_Num}[NEWLINE]Losing a Unit: -{3_Num}[NEWLINE]Killing a unit belonging to a Neptunia Civilization: {4_Num} (directly transferred between the Civilizations)[NEWLINE]Capturing/Losing a City: {5_Num}
Each Neptunia Civilization has a unique method of obtaining Shares. Check the Leader's Civilopedia page for more details. All of these extra methods only work when in normal form.
You lacked the [ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares to maintain your HDD transformation, and have forcibly reverted back to normal!
The leader of {1_Civilization} has transformed into her CPU form, {2_Leader}!
The leader of {1_Civilization} has reverted to her normal form, {2_Leader}.
The leader of {1_Civilization} was forcibly reverted to her normal form, {2_Leader}, due to a lack of [ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares!

[ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares represent divine power vested in you by citizens all over the world through military prowess, religion, and popularity. A minimum of 10% Shares are required for you to transform into your CPU form.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For more details, see the "Shares Help" button by clicking the scroll icon near the right of the screen. (If using Enhanced User Interface, it has its own button.)
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Click this button to go HDD On![ENDCOLOR]
{1_Num} from [ICON_INFLUENCE] City-States you could demand tribute from
You no longer have enough [ICON_PEACE] Faith to continue creating [ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares in {1_City}!
Click to transform into your HDD form, [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Name}[ENDCOLOR]!
Click to revert to your human form, [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Name}[ENDCOLOR].
Upon doing this, you will have the following Trait:
You may not transform or revert for another {1_Turns} turns.
You do not have enough [ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares! A minimum of {1_String} Shares is required to go HDD.

Devote the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City towards increasing your [ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares. The conversion rate is 0.01% [ICON_VV_SHARES] Shares for every 1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in the City. You may not produce Shares if you are in your CPU form.
As long as you remain in your CPU form, you can feel the warmth of the Shares coursing through you, empowering body, mind, and soul in equal measure.
A group of your countrymen have gathered together to sing your praises in front of your Basilicom as a sign of their appreciation for your protection and blessings.[NEWLINE]
Aww, how lovely. I will go out there and celebrate with them!
For once, you're having more fun outside than you are inside. The people are truly blessed to have you as their CPU!

It appears that the eternal battle between the CPUs of Gamindustri, the Console War, has begun anew. Despite the fact that you seemed to have gotten along well in the past in certain dimensions, it seems the circumstances which led to your cooperation did not come to pass here. But you won't falter. If the Console War must rage on, then you will do whatever it takes to grasp victory![NEWLINE]

[ICON_BULLET]For the rest of the game, all Hyperdimension Neptunia Civilizations in the game receive [ICON_PEACE] Faith from killing Units belonging to another Hyperdimension Neptunia Civilization[ENDCOLOR]
The Console War rages on in this world, and all of the CPUs struggle for supremacy! CPUs which kill Units belonging to other CPUs will gain [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
You gain {1_Faith} [ICON_PEACE] Faith from killing a Unit belonging to one of the inferior CPUs!

Arfoire piracy chips are beginning to spread like wildfire throughout your cities, thanks to the efforts of ASIC. This could potentially herald the coming of the Deity of Sin, the dark monstrosity whose sole desire is to see Gamindustri crumble to dust. If there is any truth to this theory, it could usher in an age of darkness for your nation.
You make efforts to curtail the appearance of ASIC, in the hopes of preventing the reappearance of the Deity of Sin.

Disgusting stories are being passed around your forums and whispered around the water coolers at work. These tall tales describe a romantic relationship between a woman...and a man. The mere thought makes your stomach tie itself into a reef knot! Only love between two girls has a place in Gamindustri, though you suppose love between two men could also be acceptable in trace amounts.
Your army of yuri goggle-clad otaku will weed out this problem in short order.
